summary: M5 (HIGH) fixed, M3 (LOW) clarified. Remaining issues: M1 (MEDIUM) partially addressed, M2/M4 (LOW) unchanged. Non-blocking.

issues.title: Magic numbers still lack decision rationale
issues.why: Added comment explains math (14s total) but not WHY these values. 'Reasonable' is subjective. Future maintainers won't know if values are tunable, based on docs, or empirically derived.
issues.fix: Add comment block explaining: (1) no published Intercom guidance, using industry standard; (2) 3 retries = standard for idempotent ops; (3) combined worst-case with timeout = 54s; (4) acceptable for batch, may need tuning for user-facing.

issues.title: Algorithm documentation still missing from docstring
issues.why: Docstring lists what errors are retried but not HOW. Maintainer must read 60 lines of branching logic to understand loop semantics, final attempt behavior, backoff calculation.
issues.fix: Enhance docstring to explain: (1) algorithm flow; (2) loop semantics (attempt 0 = first try); (3) final attempt behavior; (4) total attempts = 1 + MAX_RETRIES. See Round 1 M2 for detailed suggestion.

issues.title: JSON error handling assumption undocumented
issues.why: No explanation of what happens if response.json() fails. Is JSONDecodeError intentional fail-loud, or oversight? Maintainer won't know.
issues.fix: Add comment: 'We don't catch JSONDecodeError - if Intercom returns malformed JSON, fail loudly rather than retry (retry won't fix server-side JSON bug).'
